\begin{comment}
:Title: Circular arcs with shading

Illustration of circular arcs with shading. The arcs are drawn using
bezier curves, and the shading is done using rectangles with different
colors.

Source: Circular arcs with shading - TikZ documentation (v3.0.0-beta1)

.. index :: 1798

\end{comment}

\newcommand{\CircularArc}[6][]{%
% Syntax: [draw options] (start angle:end angle) (inside outwards:inside inwards):label
  \draw[#1] (#2) arc (#3:#4:#5) 
  node[#6] {#5}
  -- (#6) arc (#4:#3:#5) -- cycle;
}

\def\topedge{%
  (0,\myy) 
 .. controls (0.5,0.5) and (0.5,1).. 
  (1,\myy)
 .. controls (0.5,0.5) and (0.5,0).. 
  (0.5,0)
 .. controls (0.5,-0.5) and (0.5,-1).. 
  (0,-\myy)
 .. controls (0.5,-0.5) and (0.5,-1).. 
  (0.5,-1)
 .. controls (0.5,-2) and (0.5,-3).. 
  (0.5,-3)
 .. controls (1,-3) and (1,-1).. 
  (1.5,-\myy)
 .. controls (1.5,0) and (1.5,0.5).. 
  (0.5,0)
 .. controls (0.5,0.5) and (0.5,1).. 
  (0,\myy) -- cycle;
}

\def\bottomedge{%
  (0,\myy) 
 .. controls (0.5,0.5) and (0.5,1).. 
  (1,\myy) 
 .. controls (0.5,0.5) and (0.5,0).. 
  (0.5,0)
 .. controls (0.5,-0.5) and (0.5,-1).. 
  (0,-\myy) 
 .. controls (0.5,-0.5) and (0.5,-1).. 
  (0.5,-1)
 .. controls (0.5,-2) and (0.5,-3).. 
  (0.5,-3)
 .. controls (1,-3) and (1,-1).. 
  (1.5,-\myy) 
 .. controls (1.5,0) and (1.5,0.5).. 
  (0.5,0) 
 .. controls (0.5,0.5) and (0.5,1).. 
  (0,\myy) -- cycle;
}

  (0.5,0)
 .. controls (0.5,1) and (0.5,1.5)..

{%

  \backgroundpath{%
    % Save radius
    \pgfmathsetlengthmacro\radius{\pgf@x}
    % get the coordinates of the vertex
    \pgf@process{\northeast}
    \pgf@x = \dimexpr \pgf@x + \radius * 0.55 \relax
    \pgf@y = \dimexpr \pgf@y + \radius * 0.55 \relax
    % get the coordinates of the other nodes
    \pgf@process{\southwest}
    \pgf@x = \dimexpr \pgf@x + \radius * 0.55 \relax
    \pgf@y = \dimexpr \pgf@y + \radius * 0.55 \relax
    % shift the node to center the edges
    \pgf@x = \dimexpr \pgf@x + 0.5 * \radius \relax
    \pgf@y = \dimexpr \pgf@y + 0.5 * \radius \relax
    \ifdim \pgf@y < \pgf@x
      \northeast
    \else
      \southwest
    \fi
    % draw the node
    \node[%
      \ifnum\the\pgfmatrixcurrentcolumn=1\ifnum\the\pgfmatrixcurrentrow=1[
        regular polygon,
        regular polygon sides=4,
        minimum size=1cm,
        inner sep=0,
      ]\fi,
      draw,
      outer sep=1,
      inner sep=1,
    ] (x) at (\pgf@x,\pgf@y) {1};
    % draw the triangles (if any)
    \ifnum \the\pgfmatrixcurrentcolumn=1\ifnum \the\pgfmatrixcurrentrow=1[
        regular polygon,
        regular polygon sides=6,
        minimum size=1cm,
        inner sep=0,
    ]\fi ]{};
    % draw the edge
    \ifnum \the\pgfmatrixcurrentrow>1 \ifnum \the\pgfmatrixcurrentcolumn>1[
        \ifdim \the\pgf@y>\the\pgf@x
          edge[->,style=blue]
        \else % edge[->,style=green]
        \fi
      ]\fi\fi
    {
      % save the vertex
      \ifnum \the\pgfmatrixcurrentcolumn=1 \ifnum \the\pgfmatrixcurrentrow=1[
        regular polygon,
        regular polygon sides=6,
        minimum size=1cm,
        inner sep=0,
      ]\fi
      % save the direction of edge
      \pgfmathparse{atan2(\pgf@x - \the\pgfmatrixcurrentx,\pgf@y - \the\pgfmatrixcurrenty)}
      \pgf@xb=\pgfmathresult pt
      \pgf@yb=-\pgfmathresult pt
      \else
      \fi %else
      % save the edge direction
      \ifdim\pgf@x<\pgf@xb
        \ifdim \the\pgf@x < -0.01pt
          \pgfmathparse{1.5*(\the\pgf@xb - \the\pgfmatrixcurrentx)}%
          \let\distance=\pgfmathresult
          \ifdim \distance<0pt
            \def\threedist{0}

          \fi
        \else % else
          \ifdim \the\pgf@x > 0.01pt
            \pgfmathparse{1.5*(\the\pgfmatrixcurrentx + \pgf@xb)}%
            \let\distance=\pgfmathresult
            \ifdim \distance<0pt
              \def\threedist{0}
            \else
              \def\threedist{1}
            \fi
          \else % else

              \let\distance=\pgfmathresult
              \ifdim \distance<0pt

                \def\threedist{1}
              \fi
            \else % else
              \ifdim \the\pgf@y < -0.01pt
                \pgfmathparse{1.5*(\the\pgfmatrixcurrenty + \pgf@yb)}%
                \let\distance=\pgfmathresult
                \ifdim \distance<0pt
                  \def\threedist{0}
                \else
                  \def\threedist{1}
                \fi
              \else % else
                \ifdim \the\pgf@x < -0.01pt
                  \pgfmathparse{1.5*(\the\pgfmatrixcurrentx + \pgf@yb)}%
                  \let\distance=\pgfmathresult
                  \ifdim \distance<0pt
                    \def\threedist{0}

                    \def\threedist{1}
                  \fi
                \else % else
                  \ifdim \the\pgf@y > 0.01pt
                    \pgfmathparse{1.5*(\the\pgf@y - \the\pgfmatrixcurrenty)}%
                    \let\distance=\pgfmathresult
                    \ifdim \distance<0pt
